 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.

violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an

I. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
On 6/27/22, there was a physical altercation between youth and Yes
staff member at the facility. Youth was on the ground and staff
member had their sleeve pulled down to their hand and held their
hand over youth's mouth for approximately a minute.
II. METHODOLOGY
06/29/2022 Special Investigation Intake 2022C0214026
06/30/2022 Special Investigation Initiated - Face to Face interview with Youth
A.
06/30/2022 Contact - Face to Face interview with Administrator.
06/30/2022 Contact - Document Received: HR information, incident report,
Management plan, video recording, and Law Enforcement report.
06/30/2022 Inspection Completed On-site
07/05/2022 Contact - Document Received: Staff information.
07/19/2022 Contact - Telephone call made – interview with Supervisor 1.
07/19/2022 Contact - Telephone call made – interview with Staff 2.
07/25/2022 Contact - Telephone call made – interview with Staff 1.
07/26/2022 Contact - Document Received – CPI restraint techniques.
07/27/2022 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
07/28/2022 Pre exit/Exit mtg
ALLEGATION:
On 6/27/22, there was a physical altercation between youth and staff member at the
facility. Youth was on the ground and staff member had their sleeve pulled down to
their hand and held their hand over youth's mouth for approximately a minute.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 6/30/22 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. He reported remembering the restraint with Staff 1 but was
unable to recall the specifics of the incident. He does not remember his actions
when he begins hitting staff. He had no struggles breathing during the restraint with
Staff 1. He reported everything goes well for him at the facility until he begins to hit
staff. When hitting staff things do not go well for him. He gave no specifics about
things not going well. He feels safe in the facility.
Administrator/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/30/22 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported reviewing the restraint
on the video recording and noticing Staff 1 pulling his sleeve over his hand and
placing his hand over Youth A's mouth and nose. This resulted in Administrator

calling DHHS. The video was reviewed after Staff 1 filed an assault complaint with
the local law enforcement who informed Administrator. Staff 1 has had no formal
discipline since working at the facility and the only issues were dismissed. These
issues will be listed in the file review section of this report. Administrator reported it
appeared Supervisor 1 removed Staff 1's hand from Youth A's mouth/nose area
after he came upon the restraint. Staff 1 had his hand over the mouth/nose area of
Youth A for approximately 40 seconds and this is not an appropriate restraint
technique according to Administrator.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/19/22 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. He reported being present during the incident and being involved in the
restraint. Youth A was being defiant when redirected to the back hallway after
causing a disturbance during a movie on the unit. The restraint was initiated
because Youth A struck both Staff 1 and Staff 2 with a closed fist. The restraint
began as a two-person standing hold but ended in a supine hold. Youth A was
fighting the restraint by kicking, scratching, and hitting staff. Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 came to the restraint and Staff 2 "tapped out" because he was bleeding
from a scratch by Youth A. Staff 2 also reported after he tapped out, Youth A went
into a standing 2-person hold before walking to his room. He believes Youth A may
have been trying to spit at staff, but this lasted only a few seconds. Staff 1 was trying
to block the spit for a few seconds. Staff 1 had his hand above Youth A's mouth and
never covered or touched Youth A's mouth or nose. Staff 2 reported being present
during the nurse’s review and didn’t observe any marks on Youth A.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/19/22 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. He reported entering the situation and finding Supervisor 2
struggling to hold the legs of Youth A and switching out with Staff 2 because Staff 2
had a cut on his hand. Youth A made threats of spitting but did not spit on
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 also reported Youth A was on the ground for 2 to 3
minutes before getting up to a seated position and then a standing position. Youth A
then went to his room. He described the positions of staff as, Staff 1 on the right side
of Youth A, Staff 2 on the left side, and Supervisor 2 holding his legs. He also
reported his primary focus was on Supervisor 2 struggling with Youth A's legs and
he did not see Staff 1's hand over Youth A's mouth. He did observe the video
recording and saw "red flags” with Staff 1's hand appearing to be over the mouth of
Youth A. However, at the time of the restraint he did not observe anything wrong
with the techniques being used. Staff are not trained to cover the mouth when a
youth is spiting but to turn their bodies and head to avoid being spit on. He reported
never hearing Youth A say he could not breathe during the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/25/22 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. He reported being part of the restraint outlined in the allegations. The
restraint was the result of Youth A engaging in threatening behaviors towards Staff 1
after refusing the direction to return to the "back hallway" after his removal from the
group activity (movie). Staff 1 attempted to deescalate Youth A, but it did not work
and Youth A struck Staff 1 in the stomach. Youth A made several threatening

remarks and Staff 1 only responded with desecration statements. Staff 1 continued
to talk with Youth A before Youth A approached him and asked what he was going
to do just before walking over to Staff 2 and punching him in the face. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 then placed Youth A into a 2-person CPI standing position before going to the
ground. Once on the ground, Youth A was on his back (supine) with Staff 2 on his
right side holding his arm and Staff 1 on his left side holding his arm. Supervisor 2
came into the restraint and secured Youth A's legs. Staff 1 also reported hearing
Youth A "making a sound like he is going to spit on me". Staff 1 pulled his sleeve
over his hand and puts his hand over Youth A's mouth as Youth A spits. Staff 1
reported his hand was hovering over the mouth of Youth A and not touching the
mouth or restricting his breathing. Youth A bit his hand/sleeve to keep Staff 1 from
removing his hand. Staff 1 "fed the bite" to get his hand/sleeve free and Youth A
released his bite. Both Staff 1 and Staff 2 "switched out" with Supervisor 1 and Staff
4. Youth A finally calmed down and was escorted to his room by Supervisor 1 and
Staff 4. Staff 1 reported being taught to turn your back to a youth who is trying to spit
because there is "no CPI technique to block spitting". Staff 1 reported he was only
trying to protect himself and his coworkers "in a safe way".
Documents Reviewed:
Human Resources file for Staff 1. Staff 1 is current on his training requirements
and last completed a session on the facility's behavior management which is
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention (CPI) on 4/19/2022. Documentation indicates Staff 1
was accused of having oral sex with a female youth at the facility and this allegation
was documented in special investigation 2022C0137008. There were no findings,
and the youth denied the allegations. Administrator reported no formal issues with
Staff 1, but he did receive (unwritten) "counseling" when he sprayed a cleaning
solution and some of the solution came into contact with a youth.
MiSACWIS Incident Report 138110198 dated 6/27/22. This is the document
outlining the incident described in the complaint. The incident is described as Youth
A refusing to follow directions given by staff and escalating to taking off his shirt and
approaching Staff 1. Youth A attempted to push past Staff 1 when Staff 2 became
involved resulting in both staff attempting a "team control" with Youth A punching
Staff 2 in the face. Because of Youth A's aggressive behaviors, staff and Youth A
went to the ground resulting in a supine position. Supervisor 1 was able to
encourage Youth A to stop being aggressive and walk to his room. Once at the
room, Youth A became escalated again before Supervisor 1 was able to deescalate
him. There is no documentation of Youth A spitting on staff or attempting to spit on
staff in this document. Staff involved were documented as Staff 1, Staff 2,
Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2.
Oakland County Children's Village Incident Report dated 6/27/22. This
document indicates seclusion and assault on staff are reasons for the actions taken.
This document adds that Staff 1 was punched in the face by Youth A, Youth A
grabbed Staff 2's beard and was scratching and spitting. Youth A scratched Staff 2's

left arm while in the supine position (there is no documentation that they fell to the
ground). Supervisor 2 is noted as assisting with the supine position and the de-
escalation. Those involved are identified as Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3,
Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2.
County of Oakland Office of the Sheriff statement dated 6/29/22. This is
documented as a statement from Staff 2 to law enforcement. This statement is like
the two incident reports with the exception that it indicates Youth A struck Staff 1 in
the face twice.
Management Plan for Youth A dated 6/13/2022. This document indicates Youth A
is placed at the facility as "temporary detain per court order". His needs are identified
as psychiatric consultation as needed, clinical and case management services and
opportunities for recreational activities, visitation, education, and religious services.
Physical Interventions - Holding skills CPI. This document does not state
anything specifically about a youth spitting or attempting to spit on staff during a
restraint on the floor. Staff are to manage the head of the youth "in order to create a
safe physical intervention". The diagram of the position a youth and the staff were in,
indicates staff should have their back to the youth and a third staff is holding the
youth's head.
A review of the video recordings took place.
6-27-22 #1 J II Washington 7:50:29 PM. The recording begins with a above view of
the area all the youth are currently in. Youth A stands and takes off his shirt,
undershirt and walks quickly towards Staff 1 who is standing several feet away.
Youth A bumps into Staff 1 and appears to punch him in the stomach area. The
other youth are lining up and leaving the area. Staff 2 walks to the area where Staff
1 and Youth A are standing and Youth A punches Staff 2 in the head. Youth A
moves away to the other side of the room with Staff 1 and Staff 2 following. When
they reach the far corner, Youth A turns and punches Staff 1 in the head before both
staff begin to grab Youth A and start the restraint. The restraint begins with a 2-
person hold as described and Supervisor 2 enters the room and secures the legs of
Youth A. Youth A is placed on the floor with Supervisor 2 on his legs, Staff 1 holding
his right arm and side, and Staff 2 holding his left arm and side. Supervisor 1 enters
the situation and switched out Staff 1. Because this is an overhead view, Youth A's
head area is blocked by staff and a clear view is unable to be seen.
6-27-22 #2 J II Washington 7:50:54 PM. This camera view is more horizonal and
provided a clearer view of the head of Youth A. However, this view only lasts for a
few seconds before Staff 1 covers the view of Youth A’s head with his body as he
adjusts his position. Prior to this, it appears Staff 1 had pulled his sleeve over his
hand and placed his hand over the mouth and nose of Youth A. Because of the poor
view and angel, it cannot be determined if Staff 1's hand is touching Youth A's mouth

and nose. It does appear that Supervisor 1 moves Staff 1's hand away from the face
of Youth A.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Youth restraint.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 used an
inappropriate technique during the restraint of Youth A. Placing
his hand (sleeve) close to or on Youth A’s mouth and nose is
not taught by the behavior management program the facility
uses.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It was recommended the facility retrain their staff on the
appropriate method to utilize when a youth is spitting or
attempting to spit on staff.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2022C0217013 dated 12/16/21, CAP Approved 12/27/22
III. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to the
license status of this child caring institution
